event.descr:
This event is generated periodically and is a consolidated report on the fault that occurred during the last period. Events are consolidated by priority so that the count actually reflects the number of events of that priority that occurred in the last period. The airDefenseEventDescriptor varbind will contain detailed information about the LAST event of the priority reported.

airDefenseEventPriority %parm[#1]%; critical(1) major(2) minor(3) low(4)

airDefenseEventDescriptor %parm[#2]%;

airDefenseEventCount %parm[#3]%;
event.logmsg: airDefenseAlarm trap received airDefenseEventPriority=%parm[#1]% airDefenseEventDescriptor=%parm[#2]% airDefenseEventCount=%parm[#3]%

event.descr:
When enabled, this trap will report each individual occurrence of an alarm. The varbinds contain detailed information about the alarm. This trap can be sent either trough a notify PDU (trap v2) or through an inform PDU, depending on what is configured on the system. If an inform PDU is sent, a confirmation of receival will be expected. If the confirmation is not received, retransmission of the inform PDU will occur.

airDefenseDetailedEventPriority %parm[#1]%; critical(1) major(2) minor(3) low(4)

airDefenseEventTime %parm[#2]%;

airDefenseEventClassification %parm[#3]%;

airDefenseEventTypeId %parm[#4]%;

airDefenseEventTypeSubId %parm[#5]%;

airDefenseEventTypeDesc %parm[#6]%;

airDefenseEventDeviceType %parm[#7]%; ap(1) station(2) sensor(3) system(4)

airDefenseEventDeviceMAC %parm[#8]%;

airDefenseEventDeviceIP %parm[#9]%;

airDefenseEventDeviceName %parm[#10]%;

airDefenseEventLocation %parm[#11]%;

airDefenseEventGroup %parm[#12]%;

airDefenseEventSensorName %parm[#13]%;

airDefenseEventSensorMAC %parm[#14]%;

airDefenseEventSensorIP %parm[#15]%;

airDefenseEventSensorVersion %parm[#16]%;

airDefenseChannel %parm[#17]%;

airDefenseSignalStrength %parm[#18]%;

airDefenseAdditionalFields %parm[#19]%;
